hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make a lemon meringue
pie now this has been crazy crazy
requested so I'm really thrilled to be
able to share with you so let's go over
the ingredients so you get started you
need some regular white granulated sugar
some cornstarch four eggs that I have
divided into whites and the yolks and
I've beaten the yolks some confectioner
sugar water unsalted butter lemon juice
lemon zest cream of tartar salt and you
also need some pie crusts then you can
either make your own pie crust which I
have a recipe for on my website at
www.att.com/biz
and my pumpkin pie so you're free to use
that recipe or to make life a little
easier
you can buy premade pie crusts at
grocery store which is what I did but I
always buy pie crusts at the grocery
store whenever they have a really good
deal going because then I can use it
like that if I need to make it a quick
dessert first thing you want to pre-heat
your oven 350 degrees get that out of
the way second thing you wanna do I have
a 9 inch tart pan with a removable
bottom and all I'm going to do to this
is spray it just want to make sure
everything comes out right where you're
going to place our pie crust in there
and it should fit just perfectly you
don't need to cut anything out you just
want to cut it carefully just like so
you don't want to stretch it because
once you cook it it's just going to
shrink back down
so try not to stretch it as much as
possible just work it with your fingers
all this excess on top you can just clip
it off like that
remember don't stretch it now we're
going to blind bake this crust what that
means is we are going to bake this and
I'll show you with some pie weights or
you can use dried beans which is what I
use or rice or anything like that
I'm just pricking the bottom and the
sides of it because the reason why we're
blind baking
is basically because we're baking it
without any color that way it cooks all
the way through and we're using pie
plate pie pie plate pie weights in this

specifically use you can see I'm just
putting the aluminum foil time do as
neatly as possible just like that it's
perfect I have these things that I use
every time I'm gonna blind bake
something
and this hops way down so that when it
bakes it doesn't puff up because if it
puffs up when we go ahead and bake it
for like the last eight minutes with
thee without the pie weights it's going
to be kind of unevenly cooked so we're
going to do it like this in your oven
350 degrees for about 10 to 15 minutes
it usually is done at about 15 minutes
you can take it out and then I'll show
you what we're going to do with the rest

and just put it on medium heat and I'm

and now to this I'm going to add in my

essentially what we're making is a

stick it's gonna form lumps and you

sugar on the mixture is up to a bubble
and it's getting really nice and thick
at this point we're gonna add in our

whisk this into the butter melt
now that the butter is melted and the

going to take about a half a cup of this
hot mixture and I'm going to put it into
the egg yolks
now what this called is tempering and
what we're basically doing is tempering
the egg yolks because if I want to put

the ham mixture we could potentially
scramble the eggs and I don't know about

nice and thick exactly what I want I'm

crust for about 10 minutes and it should

now basically oops turn off a little bit

looking forward to is getting about a

medium for now until you start to see
